title: How to Split a Payment Between Two Cards on Amazon

steps.title: You can only split payment between a credit/debit card and an Amazon gift card.
steps.content: You can only split payment between a credit/debit card and an Amazon gift card. While you won't be able to use two of your own cards for an Amazon purchase, you can use an existing gift card balance towards your total. [3] X Research source A workaround for split payments with two cards is to buy an Amazon Gift Card with one of the cards. This gift card will be sent to you via email or text, and you can use it towards your purchase.

steps.title: Go to your Amazon cart.
steps.content: Go to your Amazon cart. You can use the Amazon app or https://www.amazon.com . If your cart is empty, you'll need to search for some products to purchase . You'll only be able to split a payment with an accepted credit or debit card and an Amazon gift card.

steps.title: Click Proceed to checkout.
steps.content: Click Proceed to checkout . This is the yellow button on the Cart page. You'll be taken to the Checkout page.

steps.title: Select a shipping address.
steps.content: Select a shipping address. If you've purchased from Amazon before, this may be filled in for you automatically. Otherwise, enter or select a shipping address.

steps.title: Select a payment method.
steps.content: Select a payment method. If you've bought from Amazon before, you may have your card information already saved. Otherwise, enter it now.

steps.title: Enter the gift card code.
steps.content: Enter the gift card code. Use the field underneath Your available balance to enter your gift card code. If you already have an eligible gift card added, you can check the box next to Use balance . [4] X Research source

steps.title: Click Use this payment method.
steps.content: Click Use this payment method . You can now select your shipping option and finalize your order. If you have Amazon Prime , you're eligible for free shipping . [5] X Research source Your two payment methods will be charged accordingly.
